column1: Charles Oliveira da Silva (born October 17
column2: 1989) is a Brazilian mixed martial artist who competes in the lightweight division. A professional MMA competitor since 2008
column3: he mainly fought in small Brazilian promotions until his move to the UFC in 2010. He holds multiple UFC records
column4: notably the most submission wins in the organization's history at 14
column5: and is tied for the most finishes at 16. Oliveira has also received 16 end of the night bonuses (including 10 performance of the night bonuses
column6: the most in UFC history). As of June 30
column8: he is #6 in the UFC lightweight rankings.

column4: but was rescheduled for UFC Live: Jones vs. Matyushenko due to visa issues. Oliveira defeated Elkins via submission (armbar) after 41 seconds of the first round. Oliveira was taken down early by Elkins

column7: forcing the tapout. The submission earned him the Submission of the Night award.
